headline: Michigan GOP candidates hoping to unseat Whitmer face challenges to nominating petitions
author: Clara Hendrickson
sentences: The challenges against former Detroit Police Chief James Craig, conservative commentator Tudor Dixon and Oakland County businessman Perry Johnson could threaten their candidacies if successful.
Gretchen Whitmer this November must fend off complaints challenging the validity of the signatures they filed on their nominating petitions to make it on the August primary ballot.
Three GOP gubernatorial candidates hoping unseat Gov.
